descriptionHtml:
[b][center][img]http://i.imgur.com/7T2Iinu.png[/img][/center]
[img]http://i.imgur.com/XwZl2O0.jpg[/img]

Enhanced Landscapes[/b] is a project which aims to improve Skyrim's landscape with more objects. This includes floral objects, rocks, ruin clutter and a lot of other landscape assets. This also aims to improve the distant appearance of mountains, cliffs and other rock formations. Requires DynDOLOD to generate proper Distant- and TreeLODs.

[color=#f1c232][b]Requirement:[/b] [/color][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/59721/?]Dynamic Distant Objects LOD - DynDOLOD by Sheson[/url]

While I've decided to release this on Nexus, it is still a work in progress and will get a lot of updates in the future. If you decide to use this mod, keep in mind that the installation process is more complex as of many other easy install and play mods. [i]Take time and read everything carefully.
[/i]
[size=2][b][color=#93c47d]Enhanced Landscapes - Basic[/color][/b]
Only contains the basic files and is the main file fo Enhanced Landscapes. You only need this file for Enhanced Landscapes to work correctly. Also contains the optional Barren Marsh & Dead Marsh plugins. I've uploaded the grasses, trees and other flora textures as optional "Flora Addon".

[b][color=#93c47d]Enhanced Landscapes - Flora Addon[/color][/b]
The Flora Addon contains grasses, trees, plants and other flora textures/meshes. Also contains the optional Solstheim Regrowth and Green Fields addons. This is available as optional file for those of you that want to use the grasses, trees and optional flora files from Enhanced Landscapes. The grasses are also available as standalone file, for those of you that only want to use the grass from Enhanced Landscapes.

[/size][i][color=#ffd966]All screenshots were taken with the Flora Addon installed.[/color][/i]

[center][/center][b][img]https://i.imgur.com/seqASv8.jpg[/img][/b]

[size=3][b]Mountains Enhanced[/b][/size]
[size=2]One of Enhanced Landscapes main features is the enhancement/improvement of Skyrims mountains with more objects and a better distant appearance. I've added thousands of rock/mountain objects all around Skyrim to completely overhaul the vanilla mountain appearance, the result is stunning, the mountains of Skyrim never have looked better.[/size]

[size=3][b]Pine Forest[/b][/size]
[size=2]The vanilla forests of Skyrim aren't really what you would call forests. Enhanced Landscapes adds hundreds of trees all over Skyrim, increases existing ones in size and makes forests feel much more dense/lush and realistic. The mod also comes with its own tree addon. I also made the forests around falkreath a lot denser and increased the tree sizes, it looks a lot better now.[/size]
[size=3][b]
Autumn Forest[/b][/size]
[size=2]The Rift got a big overhaul with a lot more floral objects and a lot of landscape improvements. I've also improved some of the smaller farms and settlements in the Rift region. The Flora Addon contains three different options for aspen trees: autumn (red, orange and yellow colors), natural (vanilla-styled, but improved textures) and summer (green colors for a more summerish look).[/size]

[size=3][b]Hjaalmarch Enhanced[/b][/size]
[size=2]The vanilla marsh is a great area but lacks in uniqueness, so Enhanced Landscapes overhauls the marsh region with more floral objects and ruin clutter to make this area a lot more beautiful and unique. There are also two optional files available for this region of Skyrim: "Barren Marsh" and "Dead Marsh". The Barren Marsh plugin removes almost all trees from the marsh and gives this region a completely new atmosphere. The Dead Marsh plugin, however, changes all pine trees in the marsh region to dead trees for a more dark-fantasy inspired look.
[/size]
[size=3][b]Volcanic Tundra Revamped[/b][/size]
[size=2]I made a lot of changes to this region. Enhanced Landscapes overhauls the rock formations, added hundred of landscape objects - existing and new ones like ferns, mushrooms, trees, small rocks, ruin clutter and much more.[/size]
[size=3][b]
Better City Outskirts[/b][/size]
[size=2]Better looking city outskirts. Enhanced Landscapes overhauls the outside areas of Markarth, Windhelm, Riften, Whiterun and Solitude. These are just small landscape changes, but they'll make the outskirts look a lot better.[/size]
[size=3][b]
[/b][b]Landscape Enhancements[/b][/size]
[size=2]Main part of Enhanced Landscpaes are thousands of changes all over Skyrim. New added floral objects, ruin clutter or just small improvements of different locations. This mod adds hundreds of objects and changes a lot of existing ones. The list is far too long to enumerate every little change, but you'll absolutely see the difference when wandering around Skyrim. I've added water lilies to a lot of rivers and lakes, overhauled the roads with many different objects and also made general enhancements to small farms, ruins and many other places throughout Skyrim.[/size]

[b][color=#6fa8dc][size=3]DLC Patch[/size][/color][/b]
Version 1.4.0+ includes a new file called "[color=#6fa8dc]Enhanced Landscapes - Patch.esp[/color]". This file fixes incompatibility with Hearthfire DLC and forwards missing/deleted records from the DLCs and Unofficial Patches (especially XCLN records).[color=#dd7e6b] Load it as last in your load order![/color]

[color=#dd7e6b][img]https://i.imgur.com/fzJWWEb.jpg[/img]
[/color][size=3][b]
Barren Marsh[/b][/size]
This optional file will remove all pine/dead trees from the marsh region and make it look barren. Gives the marsh region a completely different atmosphere.

[b][size=3]Dead Marsh[/size]
[/b]This optional file will overhaul the marsh region with new dead trees & morrowind-inspired giant mushrooms. This was originally part of the main file and is now chooseable as optional file.

[color=#dd7e6b][img]https://i.imgur.com/ooapw0u.jpg[/img][/color]

[size=3][b]Aspen and Pine Trees[/b][/size]
Enhanced trees based on Skyrim Flora Overhaul (version 2.0) and Realistic Aspen Trees with improvements to meshes and textures. You can choose between a regular and a lush version, while the regular is more performance friendly, the lush one looks a lot better. Textures are 4k and 2k, but there is also a performance option available with lower resolution textures. There are three different options for aspen trees you can choose in the installer: autumn (red, orange and yellow colors), natural (vanilla-styled, but improved textures) and summer (green colors for a more summerish look).

[size=3][b]Grasses and Plants[/b][/size]
Enhanced Landscapes contains its own and unique grass plugin. This was build on my other mod Unbelievable Grass Two, but is very different looking. You can choose between high resolution and low resolution textures. Also includes better plant textures based on Skyrim Flora Overhaul.

[size=3][b]Solstheim Regrowth[/b][/size]
Solstheim Regrowth will change Solstheims ash landscape into a more fertile and regrowth landscape with grasses, green and dead pine trees, new landscape textures and no ash-shaders on objects.

[size=3][b]Green Fields[/b][/size]
This optional file will turn the tundra region into summer-like grasslands with green grasses, new green landscape textures and proper distant terrain textures. It also changes some textures of Whiterun. Green Fields is also included in the "Grass Standalone" file.

[img]https://i.imgur.com/44ae4zE.jpg[/img]

[size=3][b][color=#dd7e6b]Requirements:[/color][color=#a82e2e] [/color][/b][/size][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/59721/?][size=3]DynDOLOD[/size]
[/url][size=2]
[b]Install[/b]

[/size][list]
[*][size=2]Download the basic file and install with a mod manager. [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/1334/]Mod Organizer[/url] is highly recommended.[/size]
[*][size=2]Choose the options you want and click at install. Optionally you can also download and install the flora addon. The flora addon includes all necessary LODGen billboards. If you want to use other tree/flora mods, make sure to install the proper LODGen billboard files.[/size]
[*][size=2]Make sure Enhanced Landscapes has a higher priority in MO as any other landscape mods! If using NMM let Enhanced Landscapes overwrite all necessary files.[/size]
[*][size=2]Enable the Enhanced Landscapes.esp and all optional esp files if you've installed them.[/size]
[/list][size=2]
[b]DynDOLOD[/b]

[/size][list]
[*][size=2]Install DynDOLOD, if you haven't already and read all included instructions how to use it. If you're already familiar with DynDOLOD this will be an easy step.[/size]
[*][size=2]Make sure Enhanced Landscapes is loaded AFTER DynDOLOD resources (priority in Mod Organizer - left pane), so it can overwrite some textures which are also included into DynDOLOD.[/size]
[*][size=2]Generate DistantLOD and TreeLOD with DynDOLOD with all Enhanced Landscapes files enabled. The output files of DynDOLOD should be loaded after Enhanced Landscapes. DynDOLOD.esp must be loaded as last (after Enhanced Landscapes.esp and all other .esp files)![/size]
[/list]
[size=3][b]Video Tutorials for DynDOLOD & Enhanced Landscapes

[/b][/size][center][youtube]3npzxXLWIwA[/youtube]   [youtube]1_5MWqeHIzw[/youtube][/center]
[b][size=3]Load Order[/size][/b]

[b][b][size=2][color=#6fa8dc]Main Files[/color]
[/size][color=#93c47d]Optional Files
[/color][color=#f6b26b]Flora Addon[/color]
[/b][/b]
[b]ESP FILES[/b]

[list]
[*][color=#6fa8dc][size=2]Enhanced Landscapes.esp[/size][/color]
[*][color=#f6b26b][size=2]Enhanced Landscapes - Grass.esp[/size][/color]
[*][color=#f6b26b][size=2]Enhanced Landscapes - DLC2Fertile.esp[/size][/color]
[*][color=#f6b26b][size=2]Enhanced Landscapes - Green Fields.esp[/size][/color]
[*][color=#93c47d][size=2]Enhanced Landscapes - Barren Marsh.esp[/size][/color]
[*][color=#93c47d][size=2]Enhanced Landscapes - Dead Marsh.esp[/size][/color]
[*][color=#6fa8dc][size=2]Enhanced Landscapes - Patch.esp[/size][/color]
[/list]
[b]MOD FOLDERS (Mod Organizer priority - left pane in MO)
[/b]
[list]
[*][color=#6fa8dc][size=2]DynDOLOD resources[/size][/color]
[*][color=#6fa8dc][size=2]Enhanced Landscapes - Basic[/size][/color]
[*][color=#f6b26b][size=2]Enhanced Landscapes - Flora Addon[/size][/color]
[*][color=#93c47d][size=2]Enhanced Landscapes - Grass[/size][/color]
[*][color=#6fa8dc][size=2]DynDOLOD output[/size][/color]
[/list]
[img]https://i.imgur.com/cNgvZ7n.jpg[/img]

With [b]Update 1.1.5+ [/b]the mod now implements a new feature regarding to compatibility patches. [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/users/3155782/?]Sheson[/url], creator of DynDOLOD, created a new method to make mods compatible without the need of ESP patches. Enhanced Landscapes now contains a "DynDOLOD" folder with a ini file. 

The ini file contains references according to esp file names which conflict. When generating LOD with DynDOLOD it will find the references, depended on the mods you use, and disables them. This doesn't mean all mods will work, below is a list with mods which were patched. Others will follow.

Make sure to load this plug-ins in TES5Edit when generating LOD with DynDOLOD, otherwise the patching function will not work.

[b]List of patched mods[/b]
[list]
[*][color=#4caac9]Enhanced Towns and Cities[/color] ([color=#dab844]works with ETaC Complete & ETaC Modular + [i]ETaC - Dragon Bridge South Addon[/i][/color]) [color=#da4444]load ETaC_Complete.esp (or any of the modular files) after Enhanced Landscapes.esp & all other EL files [/color]
[*][color=#4caac9]JK's Skyrim [/color][color=#d5d5d5]&[/color][color=#4caac9] all of JK's Town Overhauls[/color]
[*][color=#4caac9]Cutting Room Floor[/color] -[color=#da4444] load Cutting Room Floor.esp after Enhanced Landscapes & all other EL files[/color]
[*][color=#4caac9]Provincial Courier Service[/color]
[*]Other mods: [color=#4caac9]Gray Cowl of Nocturnal[/color] / [color=#4caac9]Pinegrove Lodge[/color] / [color=#4caac9]INIGO[/color] / [color=#4caac9]Routa[/color]
[*][color=#4caac9]Aurora Village[/color] (the mod includes a patch for EL, don't use it, use the patching function from DynDOLOD instead to patch this mod)
[*][color=#4caac9]Better City Entrances[/color] ([i][color=#da4444]only works with All-in-One version[/color][/i])
[*][color=#4caac9]Better Fast Travel - Carriages and Ships[/color] (works with Hearthfire and Vanilla version)
[/list]
[color=#e06666]
[/color][b][color=#93c47d]COMPATIBILITY (without patches)[/color]
[/b]
[b]Town & City mods[/b]
ETaC and JK's Skyrim were patched and are fully compatible. Other mods, which improve towns may be incompatible. Mods which edit the main cities are fully compatible.

[b]Landscape texture mods[/b]
All landscape texture mods are fully compatible.

[b]Landscape mods[/b]
There are a lot of mods available which make some small landscape edits here and there. Most of these mod only cover a few areas and only add a few objects. Enhanced landscapes aims to improve landscapes, locations, rock formations, mountains, roads and paths all over Skyrim.

[b]Simply Bigger Trees [/b]
Fully compatible with the Basic files, but since I increased alot of trees by hand, there may be some clipping or extraordinary big trees.

[b]Enhanced Vanilla Trees[/b]
Fully compatible with the Basic files. Enhanced Vanilla Trees is highly recommended if you prefer vanilla-styled trees. EVT also includes 3D Tree LOD files for LODGen, which will make the distant trees look amazing.

[b]Immersive Citizens - AI Overhaul[/b]
Compatible, though there may be some bad AI acting. Most new added objects have collision boxes with NavCut (which will prevent NPCs from walking through them). 

[b]Touring Carriages[/b]
Not compatible. Due to a lot of objects added alongside roads it will end up in issues where the carriages will not pass through.
[center][/center]
[img]https://i.imgur.com/ygLs0Hp.jpg[/img]

[center][/center][list]
[*][size=2]elinen and ztree for their [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/24735/]grass resource[/url] - [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/29486/]water plants resource[/url] - [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/55158/?]flowers resource[/url] - [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/38651/?]trees and plants[/url][/size]
[*][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/10402/?][size=2]Morrowind mushrooms - modder resource by scot[/size][/url]
[*][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/59632/?][size=2]Phitt's Sheogorad Resource[/size][/url]
[*][size=2][url=http://forums.nexusmods.com/index.php?/user/2144962-3amt/]3AMt [/url]for tree meshes and [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/users/41808/?]vurt [/url]for textures -> [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/61932/?]http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/61932/?[/url][/size]
[*][size=2][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/141/?]vurt "skyrim flora overhaul"[/url][/size]
[*][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/24364/?][size=2]AOF HD Tree LODs by AnOldFriend[/size][/url]
[*][size=2][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/users/3155782/?]sheson[/url] for creating DynDOLOD and also for a lot of advice regarding DynDOLOD. Also a big thanks for implementing a new patching function into DynDOLOD.[/size]
[*][size=2][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/users/5866043/?]Shurah[/url] for a lot of advice and help regarding AI issues caused by new added objects.[/size]
[*][size=2]A big thanks to everyone, which helps with advice, suggestions or bug reports.[/size]
[/list][size=2]
[/size][size=2][img]http://i.imgur.com/xfqQHmT.jpg[/img]
[/size]
author: AceeQ
